### Tender Description

Parks Canada Agency is seeking a Prime General Contractor with experience in Heavy Construction to undertake the Powerhouse Structural Stabilization Project at the Sault Ste. Marie Canal National Historic Site in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario.

The project involves the construction of a passive groundwater management system, including the demolition and removal of concrete sections, new concrete works, installation of contemporary valve chambers, and various minor repair works. The project must be executed in a manner that accommodates continued access to the Parks Canada maintenance crew around the immediate area of work.

The tender process consists of a two-stage solicitation, with this stage (Phase Two) inviting qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.

### Evaluation Criteria

Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

- Qualifications and experience of the contractor 
- Design and technical capabilities 
- Ability to meet project timelines and milestones 
- Compliance with trade agreements and procurement requirements
